intro: Heterosmilax pottingeri, commonly known as the Florida bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant has strap-like leaves and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as swampy areas and pine flatwoods. It is a herbaceous perennial that often forms dense colonies, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
